definitions: A notable 1980 studio album by the French post-punk and cold wave band Public Image Limited's contemporaries, specifically the band Marquis de Sade.
A cultural motif or artistic theme exploring the dichotomy between purity (virgins) and violence (bullfighters).
examples: Vierges et Toreros remains a landmark of European post-punk.
The aesthetic of Vierges et Toreros influenced many French new wave artists.
